item.title: In praise of : Great Openings
item.description: It has been advised not to judge a book by its cover (here are some clues if you do) but they did not say anything about its opening lines, which surely is a fair game. For if the author can’t take the trouble to carve out a good starting point from where rest of the story suppose to flow, then how she would handle the peak where interpretive pressure is highest.
